p: The addition of cumin essential oil had no affect on dry matter ( Table 4). pH level of silages decreased significantly in comparison to the control group (p<0.05). While cumin essential oil was found effective in the prevention of weitgh loss (WL), it was determined that WL at CMN3 and CMN5 groups was 1.46%, 1.33%, and 1.25% (p<0.05) respectively. However, LA levels in both groups increased compared to CON group (p<0.05) especially in CMN5, NH 3-N levels in treatment groups decreased (p<0.05).
